original_text: We sat down next to each other, but David wouldn't look at me. He lowered his head what he was thinking. I had high hopes for him so I wanted to let him join the cross-country. I comforted him in a soothing voice, "you have work so hard for this event. I hope your work hard is rewarding, I will support you forever." My words like a warm stream rushed his being. David raised his eyes meet my eyes with his eyes sparkling with confident. David felt inspired. I was pleased beyond description that I can light his strong determination. David was thinking for a while, "I hope I can try it." He laughed, his eyes shining with excitement. I pulled him into my arms, "I believe you can do it." I watched as David moved up to the starting line with the other runners. But David still had butterflies in his stomach and his hands were sweaty. With starting competition. So nervous was him that he was slow. I waved my arms. "You're best, you can make it, your efforts will pay off in the end. David's classmates still encouraged him warmly. David gradually lost his nervous and rushed to the end line. Eventually, David finished this competition and got the first prize. His classmates burst into thunderous applause. He was too excited to utter a word, tears of excitement blurring his eyes. My heart was glowing with happiness, "Congratulations! you beat your fear." Applause is in the air. Determination is what it takes to conquer a fear and accomplish goal.

detailed_errors.original_sentence: He lowered his head what he was thinking.
detailed_errors.correction: He lowered his head, wondering what he was thinking.
detailed_errors.explanation: 原句缺少连接词，导致句子不完整。应添加现在分词作伴随状语。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: He bowed his head, lost in thought about whether he should run.

detailed_errors.original_sentence: I had high hopes for him so I wanted to let him join the cross-country.
detailed_errors.correction: I had high hopes for him, so I wanted to encourage him to join the cross-country team.
detailed_errors.explanation: ‘join the cross-country’不完整，应加team；‘let him join’语气较生硬，改为‘encourage’更自然。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: I believed in his potential and hoped he would take part in the cross-country race.

detailed_errors.original_sentence: you have work so hard for this event.
detailed_errors.correction: you've worked so hard for this event.
detailed_errors.explanation: 动词时态错误，应使用现在完成时。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: you've put in so much effort preparing for this race.

detailed_errors.original_sentence: I hope your work hard is rewarding
detailed_errors.correction: I hope all your hard work will be rewarded.
detailed_errors.explanation: ‘work hard’是动词短语，不能作主语；应改为名词形式‘hard work’。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: I know your dedication will pay off in the end.

detailed_errors.original_sentence: with his eyes sparkling with confident
detailed_errors.correction: with his eyes sparkling with confidence
detailed_errors.explanation: confident是形容词，此处需名词形式confidence。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: his eyes lit up with unwavering confidence.

detailed_errors.original_sentence: So nervous was him that he was slow.
detailed_errors.correction: So nervous was he that he started slowly.
detailed_errors.explanation: 倒装句中主语应为he，而非him；‘was slow’表达不清，应具体化。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: Overwhelmed by nerves, he took off cautiously.

detailed_errors.correction: At the start of the competition
detailed_errors.explanation: 介词搭配错误，应为‘at the start of’。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: As the race began, the crowd erupted in cheers.

detailed_errors.original_sentence: David gradually lost his nervous and rushed to the end line.
detailed_errors.correction: David gradually overcame his nervousness and sprinted toward the finish line.
detailed_errors.explanation: ‘nervous’是形容词，应改为名词‘nervousness’；‘rushed to the end line’不够准确，应为‘finish line’。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: Driven by courage, he surged forward toward the finish line.

detailed_errors.original_sentence: Eventually, David finished this competition and got the first prize.
detailed_errors.correction: Eventually, David completed the race and won first place.
detailed_errors.explanation: ‘got the first prize’口语化，正式写作中宜用‘won first place’；‘finished this competition’不如‘completed the race’自然。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: Finally, David crossed the finish line, claiming first place.

detailed_errors.correction: The air was filled with applause.
detailed_errors.explanation: 被动语态更符合英语习惯，且‘is in the air’不够地道。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: A wave of cheers swept through the crowd.

optimizations.original_sentence: My words like a warm stream rushed his being.
optimizations.correction: My words flowed like a warm stream, touching his soul.
optimizations.explanation: 增加动词‘flowed’和宾语‘soul’，使比喻更完整、更具文学性。

optimizations.original_sentence: I was pleased beyond description that I can light his strong determination.
optimizations.correction: I was overwhelmed with joy, knowing I had helped ignite his inner strength.
optimizations.explanation: 避免‘light’的歧义，改用‘ignite’更贴切；‘inner strength’比‘strong determination’更富有表现力。

optimizations.original_sentence: But David still had butterflies in his stomach and his hands were sweaty.
optimizations.correction: Yet David’s hands trembled with sweat, and butterflies fluttered in his stomach.
optimizations.explanation: 调整语序，增强节奏感；‘fluttered’比‘had’更生动。

revised_text:
We sat down next to each other, but David wouldn't look at me. He lowered his head, wondering what he was thinking. I had high hopes for him, so I wanted to encourage him to join the cross-country team. I comforted him in a soothing voice, 'You've worked so hard for this event. I hope all your efforts will be rewarded. I'll always support you.' My words flowed like a warm stream, touching his soul. David raised his eyes to meet mine, his gaze sparkling with confidence. He felt inspired. I was overwhelmed with joy, knowing I had helped ignite his inner strength.

David paused for a moment, then said softly, 'I hope I can try it.' He smiled, his eyes shining with excitement. I pulled him into my arms and whispered, 'I believe you can do it.' As he moved to the starting line with the other runners, I noticed his hands trembling with sweat and butterflies fluttering in his stomach. At the start of the competition, so nervous was he that he took off slowly.

I waved my arms, shouting, 'You're the best! You can make it! Your efforts will pay off!' David's classmates cheered him on warmly. Gradually, he overcame his nervousness and sprinted toward the finish line. Finally, David crossed the finish line, claiming first place. His classmates burst into thunderous applause. Overwhelmed with emotion, he couldn't speak—tears of joy blurring his vision. My heart glowed with happiness. 'Congratulations! You beat your fear!' I exclaimed. The air was filled with cheers. Determination is what it takes to conquer fear and achieve greatness.
